channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: American police unions dig in as calls for reform grow
A school called off Ivanka's commencement speech. See what she blamed
item.description: Wichita State University Tech, an affiliate of Wichita State University in Kansas, canceled Ivanka Trump's virtual graduation speech amid backlash over President Donald Trump's response to George Floyd's death and the nationwide protests. CNN's Briana Keilar speaks to a graduate of the school about the decision.

item.title: Colin Powell just called out every Republican in Congress
Judge approves restraining order against Minneapolis police
Trump breaks with history in response to Floyd killing
item.description: It's been two weeks since George Floyd was killed while in the custody of Minneapolis police officers, sparking demonstrations calling for widespread policing reform across the country. But President Donald Trump has yet to meet with black advocates calling for those changes or travel to Minneapolis to speak with the community reeling in the wake of Floyd's death.

item.title: Fox News anchor apologizes after offensive image airs
item.description: Fox News anchor Bret Baier took a moment during his show to apologize for an image that aired comparing stock market performance after widely publicized cases of violence against black men.

item.title: Democrats unveil sweeping police reform bill
item.description: Democrats will put forward sweeping policing legislation Monday aimed at cracking down on police brutality and recording patterns of misuse of force across the country -- the first sign that Washington is taking action as a national movement emerges.

item.title: India reports highest single-day spike in Covid-19 cases
Covid-19 spread by people with no symptoms 'appears to be rare,' WHO official says
Teen cycles 750 miles to take her father home amid lockdown
item.description: A 15 year-old Indian girl, who cycled 750 miles to take her injured father home, has brought attention to the plight of migrant workers caught in the lockdown. Activists say her story highlights desperate measures migrants are taking under the Covid-19 lockdown in India. CNN's Vedika Sud reports.

item.title: Scientists find pattern in radio burst from space for second time ever. Their cause is still a mystery
item.description: For the second time ever, astronomers have detected a pattern in a mysterious fast radio burst coming from space.

item.title: After months at sea, the final cruise ship carrying passengers makes it home
item.description: After a six-month odyssey around the world, during which it was hit by coronavirus and saw the oceans dramatically empty of other vessels, the last cruise liner still carrying passengers has made its final port of call, delivering its eight guests to a world vastly changed from the one they set sail in.

item.title: Man who allegedly ran over protesters is admitted KKK leader, officials say
item.description: A man who is accused of driving his car through a group of protesters in Virginia is an "admitted leader of the Ku Klux Klan and a propagandist for Confederate ideology," according to the Henrico County Commonwealth's Attorney.

item.title: US prosecutors seek interview with Prince Andrew over Epstein link
item.description: The US Department of Justice has requested an interview with Prince Andrew as part of its criminal investigation into the alleged sex trafficking ring once operated by Jeffrey Epstein, according to a person familiar with the matter.

item.title: Protests passed wedding venue. Bride and groom joined them
item.description: A bride and groom in Philadelphia took a moment out of their wedding day to show solidarity with protesters that were marching against police brutality following the death of George Floyd. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: US and Russia to meet for nuclear arms negotiations
item.description: US and Russian officials will meet later this month for nuclear arms negotiations, a top US arms control official announced Monday.

item.title: China's economy is still struggling to recover from the pandemic
item.description: China is trying to dig itself out of a steep economic slump. But as the rest of the world still battles with the coronavirus pandemic, the path to recovery is looking slow and painful.

item.title: ESPN reporter to Trump official: Just stop it
item.description: ESPN reporter LZ Granderson reacts to Housing and Urban Development Secretary Dr. Ben Carson's comments during an interview with CNN's Jake Tapper on National Anthem protests.

item.title: Reebok cuts ties with CrossFit after CEO's controversial tweets about George Floyd
item.description: Gyms across the country are dropping their affiliation with CrossFit over the company's response to last week's protests.

item.title: Police inspector surrenders to face charges of assaulting student at protest
item.description: A high-ranking Philadelphia police officer accused of striking a protestor with a metal baton last week surrendered Monday, according to a public relations representative working with the police union.

item.title: The Obamas speak out on protest
item.description: Former President Barack Obama and former first lady Michelle Obama spoke candidly in their virtual commencement speeches about how they feel about the protests following George Floyd's death and what people can do to make change.

item.title: Florida police organization offers to hire cops who were fired or resigned over police misconduct
item.description: As the cries for police reform grow louder across the nation, some police departments are holding their officers accountable, firing or suspending those accused of excessive force during recent protests.

item.title: New York City exits lockdown and enters a new crisis
item.description: After 78 days of coronavirus stay-at-home orders and a death toll larger than all but six countries, New York City begins to reopen Monday.

item.title: Minneapolis mayor responds after being booed out of rally
item.description: Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey tells CNN's Chris Cuomo that he hasn't changed his stance after being booed by protesters after expressing that he is not on board for abolishing the city's police department

item.title: Country gives 10 free train journeys to all residents as lockdown eases
item.description: The Belgian government announced Saturday that it would be giving a free ten-journey rail pass to all residents, as part of a package of measures to boost domestic tourism and the economy.

item.title: Britain's biggest companies are cutting tens of thousands of jobs. Millions more are at risk
NYT editorial editor resigns after running Sen. Tom Cotton's op-ed
item.description: The editor of The New York Times' editorial page, James Bennet, has resigned, publisher A.G. Sulzberger announced. Bennet's resignation comes after the publication of a controversial op-ed from Republican Sen. Tom Cotton earlier in the week drew significant criticism, including from dozens of the newspaper's staffers.

item.title: Luxury hotels offering stellar deals for travelers amid coronavirus
item.description: As the world continues to ease lockdown measures, opportunities abound for the first wave of intrepid travelers who are willing -- and legally able -- to hit the road again.

item.title: Protesters turn newly constructed White House fence into memorial to racial justice
item.description: Though President Donald Trump hasn't declared "Black Lives Matter," the words are found all along the newly installed temporary fence that borders the White House these days.

item.title: Sen. Mitt Romney participates in Floyd protest march
item.description: Republican Sen. Mitt Romney marched with evangelicals in Washington, telling a Washington Post reporter he was participating in the demonstration "to make sure that people understand that black lives matter." CNN's Pete Muntean has more.

item.title: I was a black FBI agent. White cops didn't always see me as equal
American police shoot, kill and imprison more people than other developed countries. Here's the data
UK protesters tear down colonial-era statue
Ahmaud Arbery's mother says she's 'speechless' about new claim
item.description: CNN's Chris Cuomo speaks with Ahmaud Arbery's mother about allegations that the man accused of killing her son used a racial epithet after fatally shooting him.

item.title: Archaeologists discovered 'elaborate' details of a complete ancient city without digging
item.description: Researchers using advanced ground-penetrating radar have been able to map the entire ancient Roman city of Falerii Novi buried beneath the ground for the first time and discovered "astonishing details," according to a new study.

item.title: Rare letter detailing Van Gogh and Gauguin's brothel visits could sell for $282K at auction
item.description: The only known letter to have been jointly written by Vincent Van Gogh and Paul Gauguin, in which the former details the pair's visits to French brothels, is headed to auction.

item.title: NASCAR's Bubba Wallace wants to rid race tracks of the confederate flag
item.description: After wearing an "I Can't Breathe" T-shirt to Sunday's race, NASCAR driver Bubba Wallace said the next step is to rid the racetracks of the confederate flag.

item.title: Man rescued after six days trapped in a well
item.description: A 29-year-old British man has been rescued, after being trapped down a well on the Indonesian island of Bali for six days.

item.title: BTS and its 'Army' donates more than $2 million to Black Lives Matter
item.description: The BTS fan-based charity fundraising group "One In An ARMY" has launched a campaign to raise funds in support of the Black Lives Matter movement after the K-pop group donated $1 million.

item.title: Our oceans are amazing, but they need our help
How to lower your coronavirus risk while eating out: Advice from an infectious disease expert
item.description: As restaurants and bars reopen to the public, it's important to realize that eating out will increase your risk of exposure to the new coronavirus.

item.title: This baby fox was rescued by firefighters after getting its head stuck in a wheel
item.description: British firefighters have rescued an inquisitive fox cub that had got its head stuck in a rusty wheel.

item.title: See Drew Brees' message to Trump about police violence
item.description: In a message to President Donald Trump, New Orleans Saints quarterback Drew Brees stood by his apology for previously stating that he would "never agree with anybody disrespecting the flag of the United States of America or our country" during an interview with Yahoo Finance.

item.title: New Zealand's star tourism attraction struggles as visitors stay away post-Covid
item.description: It's a stunning fall morning in Queenstown, New Zealand. Trees with orange leaves border the calm Lake Wakatipu, and craggy mountains -- the kind made famous by Peter Jackson's "Lord of the Rings" movies -- tower in the distance.

item.title: Kourtney Kardashian feels 'responsibility' to talk white privilege with her kids
item.description: Kourtney Kardashian is urging mothers to use this time of protests as a teachable moment.

item.title: Airbnb is making a huge comeback
item.description: Here's another sign that summer travel is rebounding: Airbnb said it's experiencing a surge in bookings as customers emerge from several months of being cooped up in their homes because of Covid-19.

item.title: In wake of recent protests, powerful labor unions representing law enforcement officers across the US are preparing for a once-in-a-generation showdown over policing
George Floyd's funeral will be live-streamed today
item.description: Family and close friends will gather in Houston on Tuesday for the funeral of George Floyd, two weeks after he died at the hands of Minneapolis police officers.

item.title: Judge OKs restraining order against Minneapolis police
Black man heard saying 'I can't breathe' during fatal Texas arrest
item.description: Body camera footage of a black man's arrest in Austin, Texas, where he says "I can't breathe" multiple times is under investigation.
